champ.champInfo:
The general management of the organization and conduct of competitions is carried out by the non-Olympic department of sports, scientific and medical support of the department of sports of the highest achievements of the State Youth and Sports Service of Ukraine (hereinafter referred to as the State Service) together with the Ukrainian Kyokushinkai Federation karate (hereinafter referred to as the Federation). The direct holding of the competition is entrusted to the Department of Family, Youth and Sports Irpin state administration


Organizing committee and judges:

  • The main judge of the competition is A.V. Zverev
  • Chief Secretary - K.Y. Chorna
  • Technical support â€” Tatarchenko I.Yu. (Lviv)

Venue of the competition: Irpin, str. Severynivska 129-B

The competition will be held in Irpin on March 3, 2024.

Competition program

March 3 (Sunday):

  • 08:00 - 09:00 team registration, preliminary weighing of participants
  • 09:00 - 09:30 judges' seminar in the "kumite" section, judges' meeting, formation of teams
  • 09:30 - 11:45 start of qualifying competitions in the "kumite" section
  • 11:45 - 11:55 line-up of judges, team representatives, invited officials, line-up of participants for the entrance march
  • 12:00 - 12:30 ceremonial opening of the competition (parade of participants of all sections of the competition)
  • 12:40 - 18:00 final part of the competition
  • 18:00 - 19:00 awarding of winners and prize-winners of all sections of the competition, closing of the competition

Competition rules.

  • Competitions (individual) are held separately for female participants in the kumite section in the Olympic style
  • If, based on previous applications, there is an insufficient number of participants for high-quality holding of competitions in certain categories, the Organizing Committee may make the following changes to the Regulations for these competitions:
    • merge bordering weight categories
    • hold competitions in specified weight categories in a round-robin fashion
  • Competitions are held separately for male and female participants

Competition participants.

  • All participants must submit the following documents to the mandate committee
    • application letter for participation according to the established form, approved by the medical and physical culture dispensary
    • additional application form according to the established form, approved by the head of the sports organization
    • passport or birth certificate
    • score membership book with parents' visa for permission to participate in competitions for minors
    • a copy of the payment order for the payment of the charity contribution for participation in the competition
    • voluntary insurance policy
  • Participants compete in appropriate uniforms and personal protective protectors in accordance with the Rules of Kyokushinkai karate competitions in force in Ukraine
  • White shin and groin protectors, girls' chest protector (to be worn under a white T-shirt) are personal and mandatory
  • Helmets will not be provided by competition organizers

Categories of participants:
series A (8 kyu and above)
series B (0 - 9 kyu)

Kamite series A and series B separately:
Year of birth Gender Weight categories Regulations
2012-2013 Boys/Girls -35 -40 -45 -50 +50 1.5 min., 1 min., 2 kg., 1 min.
2014-2015 Boys/Girls -25 -30 -35 -40 +40 1 min., 1 min., 2 kg., 1 min.
2016-2017 Boys/Girls -20 -25 -30 -35 +35 1 min., 1 min., 2 kg., 1 min.
2018-2018 Boys/Girls -20 -25 -30 +30 1 min., 1 min., 2 kg., 1 min.
Kamite series A and series B are combined.
Girls - series A and B separately if there is a sufficient number of athletes - at least 3 people in the category
Year of birth Gender Weight categories Regulations
2010-2011 Girls -30 -35 -40 -45 -50 +50 1 min., 1 min., 2 kg., 1 min.
2010-2011 Young men -40 -45 -50 -55 -60 +60 1 min., 1 min., 2.5 kg., 1 min.
2008-2009 Girls -40 -45 -50 -55 -60 +60 1 min., 1 min., 2.5 kg., 1 min.
2008-2009 Young men -45 -50 -55 -60 -65 +65 1.5 min., 1.5 min., 2.5 kg., 1.5 min.
2006-2007 Junior girls -50 -55 -60 -65 +65 1.5 min., 1.5 min., 2.5 kg., 1.5 min.
1990-2005 Women -55 -60 -65 +65 3 min., 2 min., 3 kg., 2 min.

Competition conditions

Competitions are held in accordance with the "Kyokushinkai Karate Competition Rules" in force in Ukraine

Financing

Expenses for organizing competitions (awarding winners and prize-winners, renting sports equipment buildings and auxiliary premises, competition headquarters and office equipment, rent of tatami mats, payment stationery, medicines, medical and service personnel, printing posters and others paraphernalia for competitions, preparation of competition venues, placement of advertisements, transport and other expenses on the organization of competitions) are carried out at the expense of the department of culture, youth and sports Gostomel settlement council

Awards

  • Athletes who took 1-3 places are awarded diplomas of the respective degrees, medals and cups

Registration

Registration for participation in the competition takes place through a personal account until February 25, 2024. or by e-mail:
(hidden)
Ihor Yuriyovych Tatarchenko tel. +38(067)-788-77-28
In case of need for accommodation of participants, representatives, judges - inform by phone
Petrenko Iryna Vitalyivna tel. +38(095) 13-11-789, (hidden)

Application letter for participation in the established form, other necessary documents and insurance poles are submitted to the mandate commission during the medical commission and weighing of the participants. Teams that have confirmed their participation within the set deadline are admitted to the competition
